page.title: 09Parish Church: Winterbourne
page.content: St. Michael's church is very old and it is thought that the foundations were put down before the Norman Conquest. In 1983 there was an 'It's a Knockout' contest to help raise money for the church bells. Our school took part and came first. A good deal of money was raised and the bells were rehung. This year there was a churchyard festival to help raise money towards the upkeep of the churchyard. Many things went on during the week of the festival including guided tours of the church and a demonstration by a stone mason. Children from our school helped by providing work for a display inside the church. We did rubbings of gravestones, drew pictures of the churchyard and wrote poems about our visit to this beautiful old church.
